availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Billiter and Nancy Billiter. Married to Mollie Billiter. Carpenter in Grant County, Kentucky, in 1860. Carpenter in Grant County in 1863. Arrested for being a confederate sympathizer in Grant County on July 16, 1862. Imprisoned at Camp Chase, Ohio, until November 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules,
Kentucky, Grant County, p. 162.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Grant County, KY, July 1863, p. 45.
Selected Records of the War Department Relating to Confederate Prisoners of War, 1861-1865, Roll M598_24, pp 238-239, “U.S., Civil War Prisoner of War Records, 1861-1865.”
"Overton P Billiter (1832-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial #21377961, accessed August 18, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21377961.
